EXTRACTED VALUE: An enjoyable diversion a few months in the US/Euro launch lineup, but an irrelevant game now with bigger/better FPS’s now on the 360.
The combat is too beautiful not to appreciate, but players will find the camera a far tougher opponent than Ryu's enemies. The rush is diminished.
A series of amazing shocks that are never quite worthy of suspension of disbelief.
Where the actual game experience falls short, the online community experience impresses. [Apr 2006, p.89]
Kameo isn’t the deepest or most challenging game in the Xbox 360 launch window, but it looks awesome and offers solid, if fleeting, fun.
